channel.title: A good range formula?
channel.description:
Does anyone have one? Formula for max range hit. I'm not in the guess-and-check or the long-decimal mood, so could someone please spare theirs? Yes, this will [b]help[/b] my [b]server[/b].
Thank you.

item.title: A good range formula?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[code] public int getRangeMaxHit() {
double d = 0.0D;
double d1 = playerLevel[playerRanged];
int i = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerRanged]);
int j = playerEquipment[playerWeapon];
int k = playerEquipment[playerArrows];

	d += 1.05D + d1 * 0.00125D;
	d += d1 * 0.11D;

	if (j == 800 || j == 806 || j == 825 || j == 864) {
		d *= 0.69999999999999996D;
	} else if (j == 801 || j == 807 || j == 820 || j == 863) {
		d *= 0.71999999999999997D;
	} else if (j == 802 || j == 808 || j == 827 || j == 865) {
		d *= 0.79000000000000004D;
	} else if (j == 803 || j == 809 || j == 828 || j == 866) {
		d *= 0.83999999999999997D;
	} else if (j == 804 || j == 810 || j == 829 || j == 867) {
		d *= 0.98999999999999999D;
	} else if (j == 805 || j == 811 || j == 830 || j == 868) {
		d *= 1.24D;
	} else if (j == 6522) {
		d *= 1.6399999999999999D;
	} else if (j == 4212 || j == 4214) {
		d *= 2.25D;
	} else if (k == 882 || k == 883) {
		d *= 1.042D;
	} else if (k == 884 || k == 885) {
		d *= 1.044D;
	} else if (k == 886 || k == 887) {
		d *= 1.1339999999999999D;
	} else if (k == 888 || k == 889) {
		d *= 1.2D;
	} else if (k == 890 || k == 891) {
		d *= 1.3500000000000001D;
	} else if (k == 892 || k == 893) {
		d *= 1.6000000000000001D;
	} else if (k == 4740) {
		d *= 1.95D;
	} else if (k == 8065) {
		d *= 1.5D;
	} else if (k == 7988) {
		d *= 2.1000000000000001D;
	} else if (k == 7990) {
		d *= 2.6000000000000001D;
	}

	if (specialDamageDelay != -1l) {
		if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 861) {
			d *= 1.05D;
		} else if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 7958) {
			d *= 1.6399999999999999D;
		}
	}
	return (int)Math.floor(d);
}[/code]

Edit ‘specialDamageDelay’ to whatever you use for damage delays.

Read full topic
